tha-ap436:0.3_0: He has laid down the burden, and gone beyond,
tha-ap436:1.2_0: like a burning flame, the flame.
tha-ap436:1.4_0: I saw the supreme among men.
tha-ap436:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Āḷavikā.
tha-ap436:11.1_0: and a fourth part of the senior monks who’ve practiced these fourth.
tha-ap436:2.2_0: like a fish by a pung;
tha-ap436:2.4_0: I am the best of Buddhas.
tha-ap436:3.3_0: if he gives a nun to one who has something left over;
tha-ap436:4.2_0: to look around in the Saṅgha,
tha-ap436:4.3_0: You have no knowledge about this,
tha-ap436:4.4_0: as far as the scope of the Buddha extends.
tha-ap436:5.3_0: I bow to the great hero,
tha-ap436:5.4_0: is a debater of all knowledge.’
tha-ap436:6.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap436:6.4_0: This is the fruit of knowledge.
tha-ap436:7.1_0: My defilements have been burnt away by practicing absorption—
tha-ap436:9.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
